posts.post_content:
+1 Greatly protects herself and dares anything to come at her while building counters.  
-3 Deal with any threat, except if that threat is a land.  
-7 One of the most hilarious ultimate's I have seen on a planeswalker.  
  
I would play her in a control deck, and spam her +1 building a ton of counters. I would not ult unless I could [duress](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=duress) first, and be given insurance that it would be a real threat to win the game. Basically I would use her as a nonland [vindicate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=vindicate) on a stick, and very conservative to spend her loyalty.  
  
I foresee her price staying up there for a while, crossing my fingers that it gos down for some reason so I can play with her.  
  
Fantastic art, creative planeswalker, 5/5
posts.html:
+1 Greatly protects herself and dares anything to come at her while building counters.
-3 Deal with any threat, except if that threat is a land.
-7 One of the most hilarious ultimate's I have seen on a planeswalker.

I would play her in a control deck, and spam her +1 building a ton of counters. I would not ult unless I could duress first, and be given insurance that it would be a real threat to win the game. Basically I would use her as a nonland vindicate on a stick, and very conservative to spend her loyalty.

I foresee her price staying up there for a while, crossing my fingers that it gos down for some reason so I can play with her.

Fantastic art, creative planeswalker, 5/5

posts.post_content:
According to her story, she's actually a novice to the Planeswalker scene (2 years or so).  
Which, flavorfully, kinda makes sense.  
+1: She's a gorgon. She naturally has this.  
-3: One of her new powers she's harnessed (maybe an amplified use of her "natural" gorgon prowess?).  
-7: She's able to conjure more powerful minions (possibly from a whole other plane) to do her bidding.  
I think that's pretty awesome.

Posted By: Totema (9/25/2012 10:43:27 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I really like Vraska. I love Golgari, and this new planeswalker looks like so much fun! She's got a really flavorful backstory if you read DailyMTG, and the card itself looks very bomby and fun. She is just the way a planeswalker should be: fun, splashy, and not an overpowered "I win" card. I especially like her ultimate, in that it is really unique and powerful, but also easy to deal with by virtually any removal spell. Plus, she is very multiplayer friendly  
  
5/5 for being a force to be reckoned with, but in a fun way!

posts.post_content:
[Sorin Markov](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sorin Markov) :"Oh hi, you must be that new walker the boss called in. Ready for the big battle?"
  
Vraska: "Very. To show my loyalty I've vowed to destroy anyone foolish enough to attack me."
  
Sorin: "Nice. The boss cashed in a bunch of my loyalty to have me do a little mind control trick. I'll be deciding how our enemies attack."
  
Vraska: "Oh. So you'll just have them not attack at all?"
  
\*Sorin pats Vraska on the shoulder and walks away chuckling\*
  
Vraska: "Sorin? Sorin? ......uh-oh."

Posted By: Gcrudaplaneswalker (9/25/2012 5:57:31 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
On the one hand, I like her. Definately got some interesting ability. On the other hand... Her + ability doesn't protect her. Creatures and burn and the like can kill her just as easily as if she wouldn't have that ability. Yes, creatures die, but that can even be an advantage for the opponent. Some creatures have powerful "die" triggers, or you want them in your graveyard for other reasons, such as scavenge.  
  
The -3 ability is great. But To use it even twice without her dying, you'd have to spend a total of four turns. That's a long time.  
  
And the last ability is pretty unique and interesting. But also less powerful than many other commanders ultimates.
posts.html:
On the one hand, I like her. Definately got some interesting ability. On the other hand... Her + ability doesn't protect her. Creatures and burn and the like can kill her just as easily as if she wouldn't have that ability. Yes, creatures die, but that can even be an advantage for the opponent. Some creatures have powerful "die" triggers, or you want them in your graveyard for other reasons, such as scavenge.

The -3 ability is great. But To use it even twice without her dying, you'd have to spend a total of four turns. That's a long time.

And the last ability is pretty unique and interesting. But also less powerful than many other commanders ultimates.

Posted By: superskejcik (10/12/2012 10:52:35 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Sad things this planeswalker has a so weak impact on the board. If an opponent sets himself all tapped to cast Vraska, I won't counter it. He uses Vraska's +1 ? Well, I'll just bash him as if Vraska didn't exist. He uses Vraska's -2 ? He'll have spent five mana for a Maelstrom Pulse then I'll bash Vraska. He threatens me to use Vraska's ultimate in three turns ? That means three more bashes plus enough time to search for a board sweeper. Vraska is not a bad concept in itself, it's just that it costs a hell lot of mana for what it does. For five mana you can expect something that clearly impacts the board. Gideon turns the tide of the battle, Tamiyo locks the opponent and her ultimate is 1000 times better, even Jace 3 (which is not played at all) is a one-sided Howling Mine. Vraska reads as a Maelstrom Pulse that makes you gain two life, for five mana at sorcery speed. I love planeswalkers, but this one is really disappointing.
